alert.note: Alert for Clark; Ford; Kiowa (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 5:31PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ford, southwestern Kiowa and northeastern Clark Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 531 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Clark State Lake, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bucklin around 550 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mullinville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
